This work presents SkinningNet, a Two-Stream Graph Convolutional Neural Network that automatically generate skinning weights for an input mesh and its associated skeleton. The SkinningNet architecture is based on the novel Multi-Aggregator Graph Convolution layer that allows the network to better generalize for unseen topologies. Moreover, the proposed joint-based skinning binding and Mesh-Skeleton network learn to find the best relationships between the mesh and skeleton helping to improve the final skinning weight predictions. The proposed architecture outperforms current approaches with over a 20% improvement on mesh deformation error and is also able to generalize better for complex characters of unseen domains.

If you find this work useful, please consider citing:

	Albert Mosella-Montoro, Javier Ruiz-Hidalgo, SkinningNet: Two-Stream Graph Convolutional Neural Network for Skinning Prediction of Synthetic Characters, CVPR, 2022
